upgrades.rationale: Position 2 active Turn 2+. +1 influence pool for 6 turns = 6 extra cubes this cycle. Best ROI for cheap upgrade.
Reaches Level 3 (2 total upgrades with existing L2). Promotion eligible. Maritime faction valuable for Docks control.
Position 4 active Turn 4+. +1 influence pool for 4 turns. Religious faction enables Temple district access.
Reaches Level 3 (2 total upgrades). Promotion eligible. Vane can be promoted into Religious courtier next transition.
Position 5 active Turn 5+. +1 influence pool for 3 turns. Criminal faction maintains courtier access.
Position 6 active Turn 6+. +1 influence for final turns. Religious faction redundancy with Vane.

gold_conversion.note: Only 1 gold - insufficient for conversion (requires 3:1 ratio)

reasoning: FINAL CYCLE OPTIMIZATION: Trailing P2 by 4 VP (108 vs 112), every decision must maximize competitive advantage. Strategy: spend 6 VP on cheap 1-VP upgrades to maximize influence pool across the 7-turn final cycle. This yields +15 extra influence cubes total - far exceeding the 6 VP cost in territorial control potential. Two agents (Blackbeard, Vane) reach Level 3 for promotion eligibility, advancing the 8/14 courtier victory path. Avoided expensive 4-VP upgrades as the VP cost outweighs marginal benefit in final cycle. Captain Varro already maxed at L3 with 4 upgrades. Post-upgrade VP: 102 (10 behind P2's 112). The 15 extra cubes must translate to 10+ VP through superior district control to overcome the deficit. Mathematical trajectory: influence superiority enables territorial dominance which generates the VP needed to close the gap.
